author: sky.cactus
content: Ideal term is one that a user can intuit to mean "unlikely to reorg".

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm fine with `safe`, but I'm also fine with `reliable` or `durable`.  I'm not a big fan of `solid`.

author: sky.cactus
content: Alternatively we could abstract it away a bit and just have a numbered reliability scale or something.  I'm not sure the API layer is the right place to do that though.

author: m.kalinin
content: I don't think there is a way to properly define this scale. What could the scale factor be? A portion of adversarial stake that is required to revert a block would be useful but it's hard to compute it in general case.

author: m.kalinin
content: A PR that adds justified block to Ethereum JSON-RPC with the corresponding change to Engine API https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/203
